Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can a judicial review of a negative PRRA decision proceed after the applicant has been removed from Canada?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 112 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
Crimes.Application_Facts: The applicant, a failed refugee claimant, was deported before her judicial review of the negative PRRA decision.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of negative PRRA decision
Crimes.Court_Ruling: The application for judicial review is dismissed as it is moot due to the applicant's removal from Canada.
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Presence of adversarial relationship and public interest
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing of removal relative to judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Record of removal and PRRA refusal
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal and judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Judicial review of a negative PRRA decision is moot if the applicant is no longer in Canada.
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No ongoing harm from decision post-removal
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant sought judicial review of a negative PRRA decision after being deported.
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed file and legal precedents
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant due to overstaying and removal
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Lack of jurisdiction due to mootness
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Purpose of PRRA is to assess risk before removal; post-removal review lacks purpose.

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can a judicial review of a negative PRRA decision proceed after the applicant has been removed from Canada?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 112 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
Crimes.Application_Facts: The applicant was deported before her PRRA decision was reviewed.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of negative PRRA decision
Crimes.Court_Ruling: The application for judicial review is dismissed as moot due to the applicant's removal from Canada.
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing of removal relative to judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Record of removal and PRRA refusal
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal and judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Judicial review of a negative PRRA decision is moot if the applicant is no longer in Canada.
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No ongoing harm from decision post-removal
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant, a failed refugee claimant, sought judicial review of a negative PRRA decision after being deported.
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed legal precedents and file
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant due to failed claim and removal
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Lack of jurisdiction due to mootness
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Hearing the case would not serve judicial economy or public interest.

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the court exercise discretion to hear a judicial review of a negative PRRA decision after the applicant has been removed from Canada?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 112 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA)
Crimes.Application_Facts: The applicant was deported before her PRRA decision was reviewed.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of negative PRRA decision
Crimes.Court_Ruling: The application for judicial review is dismissed as moot, with no question certified.
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Request for stay of removal denied
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Record of removal and PRRA refusal
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal and judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Judicial review of a negative PRRA decision is moot if the applicant is removed from Canada before the decision is made.
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No ongoing harm from decision post-removal
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant, a failed refugee claimant, sought judicial review of a negative PRRA decision after being deported.
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Lack of jurisdiction due to mootness
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No adversarial relationship or public interest in hearing the application post-deportation.
